intro.title: Worry vs Fear
educationalText: Worry imagines future what-ifs, while fear reacts to an immediate, present danger.
Knowing which one you feel helps you choose the right response and calm faster.
intro.scientificContent:
Fear and worry are distinct emotional responses:

â€¢ Fear activates when facing immediate danger, triggering the fight-or-flight response to protect you now.

â€¢ Worry focuses on uncertain future events, often leading to rumination about "what if" scenarios.

Understanding the difference helps you choose appropriate coping strategies: action for fear, planning for worry.

categoryA.name: Fear
categoryA.subtitle: (Immediate)
categoryA.educationalText: Fear is about immediate danger or threats happening right now.

categoryB.name: Worry
categoryB.subtitle: (Future)
categoryB.educationalText: Worry is about future possibilities and "what-if" scenarios.
